1_1NmT7R64j1uMJ9qs3Bfgda5cGczFqNmCBL.body: for what reason... java programmers paid the best (big and rich companies stuck with java), but if you want to be more productive (startups, etc), javascript would be a good choice, as it's used in the backend (node.js), frontend (which runs in the browser), and database (mongodb, or anything with json, instead of SQL / etc). What is you goal ? earn much, or be productive. I know it's controversial....

> [delusion](#comment_4_1eQKH8VcGoV17tUEfCHad8pMix9qR8aVu): learning javascript is a terrible choice if you're not interested in building web driven crap.javascript is also a pile of garbage and a security nightmare.

it has a huge community who probably things the same, but it pays well (enterprise demand), and relatively easy to learn and use (as I said, ~same logic for frontend javascript, backend javascript, and database.). Well, not entirely the same, but the difference is smaller than in alternative stacks.

There are a lots of languages out there, with big community support, and I think, as experienced devs, we shouldn't do the same as religions, which says crap to anything else (that's only my opinion, I respect diversity)
